result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keenen Michael Hill

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Services Status Report 10-24-22

Defendant Keenen Michael Hill in court.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Keenen Michael Hill.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a plea and sentencing hearing. Defendant plans to hire a private attorney. Case is adjourned for a plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-6-22, filed.

Defendant Keenen Michael Hill in court.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Keenen Michael Hill.  Attorney Samuel Simpson for Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned to branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed.

Case recalled.  Defendant Keenen Michael Hill in court.  Michelle Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Court scheduled a projected guilty plea date.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 AM.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defendant does not appear.  Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued with REMAND TO JUDGE upon return of the bench warrant.  Court took no action on bail.  Court will cancel bench warrant if defendat appears in court by end of business day.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-5-22
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Keenen Michael Hill in court, appear by video with attorney Merra A-Henaey appear by video for Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs .  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Lozano. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court in person, defendant Keenen Michael Hill not in court, in custody.  ADA Hira appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The defendant was taken into custody this morning and is currently in the booking process; unable to appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Pretrial Services Supervision (VIOLATION) Report; filed.
Nathan Opland-Dobs; filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Keenen Michael Hill in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Keenen Michael Hill in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keenen Michael Hill appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Keenen Michael Hill

Prior: 3892 North 11th Street #3, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
